039

041import java.awt.BasicStroke;

054import java.io.ObjectOutputStream;
055import java.io.Serializable;
056import java.util.List;
057import java.util.Objects;

075/**
076 * A fast scatter plot.
077 */
078public class FastScatterPlot extends Plot implements ValueAxisPlot, Pannable,
079        Zoomable, Cloneable, Serializable {
080
081    private FastScatterPlotProduct fastScatterPlotProduct = new FastScatterPlotProduct();
082
083        /** For serialization. */
084    private static final long serialVersionUID = 7871545897358563521L;
085
086    /** The default grid line stroke. */
087    public static final Stroke DEFAULT_GRIDLINE_STROKE = new BasicStroke(0.5f,
088            BasicStroke.CAP_BUTT, BasicStroke.JOIN_BEVEL, 0.0f, new float[]
089            {2.0f, 2.0f}, 0.0f);
090
091    /** The default grid line paint. */
092    public static final Paint DEFAULT_GRIDLINE_PAINT = Color.lightGray;
093
094    /** The data. */
095    private float[][] data;
096
097    /** The x data range. */
098    private final Range xDataRange;
099
100    /** The y data range. */
101    private final Range yDataRange;
102
103    /** The domain axis (used for the x-values). */
104    private ValueAxis domainAxis;
105
106    /** The range axis (used for the y-values). */
107    private ValueAxis rangeAxis;
108
109    /**
110     * A flag that controls whether or not panning is enabled for the domain
111     * axis.
112     */
113    private boolean domainPannable;
114
115    /**
116     * A flag that controls whether or not panning is enabled for the range
117     * axis.
118     */
119    private boolean rangePannable;
120
121    /** The resourceBundle for the localization. */
122    protected static ResourceBundle localizationResources
123            = ResourceBundle.getBundle("org.jfree.chart.plot.LocalizationBundle");
124
125    /**
126     * Creates a new instance of {@code FastScatterPlot} with default
127     * axes.
128     */
129    public FastScatterPlot() {
130        this(null, new NumberAxis("X"), new NumberAxis("Y"));
131    }
132
133    /**
134     * Creates a new fast scatter plot.
135     * <p>
136     * The data is an array of x, y values:  data[0][i] = x, data[1][i] = y.
137     *
138     * @param data  the data ({@code null} permitted).
139     * @param domainAxis  the domain (x) axis ({@code null} not permitted).
140     * @param rangeAxis  the range (y) axis ({@code null} not permitted).
141     */
142    public FastScatterPlot(float[][] data,
143                           ValueAxis domainAxis, ValueAxis rangeAxis) {
144
145        super();
146        Args.nullNotPermitted(domainAxis, "domainAxis");
147        Args.nullNotPermitted(rangeAxis, "rangeAxis");
148
149        this.data = data;
150        this.xDataRange = calculateXDataRange(data);
151        this.yDataRange = calculateYDataRange(data);
152        this.domainAxis = domainAxis;
153        this.domainAxis.setPlot(this);
154        this.domainAxis.addChangeListener(this);
155        this.rangeAxis = rangeAxis;
156        this.rangeAxis.setPlot(this);
157        this.rangeAxis.addChangeListener(this);
158
159        fastScatterPlotProduct.setPaint2(Color.RED);
160
161        fastScatterPlotProduct.setDomainGridlinesVisible2(true);
162        fastScatterPlotProduct.setDomainGridlinePaint2(FastScatterPlot.DEFAULT_GRIDLINE_PAINT);
163        fastScatterPlotProduct.setDomainGridlineStroke2(FastScatterPlot.DEFAULT_GRIDLINE_STROKE);
164
165        fastScatterPlotProduct.setRangeGridlinesVisible2(true);
166        fastScatterPlotProduct.setRangeGridlinePaint2(FastScatterPlot.DEFAULT_GRIDLINE_PAINT);
167        fastScatterPlotProduct.setRangeGridlineStroke2(FastScatterPlot.DEFAULT_GRIDLINE_STROKE);
168    }
169
170    /**
171     * Returns a short string describing the plot type.
172     *
173     * @return A short string describing the plot type.
174     */
175    @Override
176    public String getPlotType() {
177        return localizationResources.getString("Fast_Scatter_Plot");
178    }
179
180    /**
181     * Returns the data array used by the plot.
182     *
183     * @return The data array (possibly {@code null}).
184     *
185     * @see #setData(float[][])
186     */
187    public float[][] getData() {
188        return this.data;
189    }
190
191    /**
192     * Sets the data array used by the plot and sends a {@link PlotChangeEvent}
193     * to all registered listeners.
194     *
195     * @param data  the data array ({@code null} permitted).
196     *
197     * @see #getData()
198     */
199    public void setData(float[][] data) {
200        this.data = data;
201        fireChangeEvent();
202    }
203
204    /**
205     * Returns the orientation of the plot.
206     *
207     * @return The orientation (always {@link PlotOrientation#VERTICAL}).
208     */
209    @Override
210    public PlotOrientation getOrientation() {
211        return PlotOrientation.VERTICAL;
212    }

236        fireChangeEvent();
237    }

260        this.rangeAxis = axis;

262    }

286    }

299    }

311        fastScatterPlotProduct.setDomainGridlinesVisible(visible, this);
312    }

397    }

435    /**
436     * Receives a chart element visitor.
437     * 
438     * @param visitor  the visitor ({@code null} not permitted).
439     */
440    @Override
441    public void receive(ChartElementVisitor visitor) {
442        this.domainAxis.receive(visitor);
443        this.rangeAxis.receive(visitor);
444        super.receive(visitor);
445    }
446
447    /**
448     * Draws the fast scatter plot on a Java 2D graphics device (such as the
449     * screen or a printer).
450     *
451     * @param g2  the graphics device.
452     * @param area   the area within which the plot (including axis labels)
453     *                   should be drawn.
454     * @param anchor  the anchor point ({@code null} permitted).
455     * @param parentState  the state from the parent plot (ignored).
456     * @param info  collects chart drawing information ({@code null}
457     *              permitted).
458     */
459    @Override
460    public void draw(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D area, Point2D anchor,
461                     PlotState parentState, PlotRenderingInfo info) {
462
463        // set up info collection...
464        if (info != null) {
465            info.setPlotArea(area);
466        }
467
468        // adjust the drawing area for plot insets (if any)...
469        RectangleInsets insets = getInsets();
470        insets.trim(area);
471
472        AxisSpace space = new AxisSpace();
473        space = this.domainAxis.reserveSpace(g2, this, area,
474                RectangleEdge.BOTTOM, space);
475        space = this.rangeAxis.reserveSpace(g2, this, area, RectangleEdge.LEFT,
476                space);
477        Rectangle2D dataArea = space.shrink(area, null);
478
479        if (info != null) {
480            info.setDataArea(dataArea);
481        }
482
483        // draw the plot background and axes...
484        drawBackground(g2, dataArea);
485
486        AxisState domainAxisState = this.domainAxis.draw(g2,
487                dataArea.getMaxY(), area, dataArea, RectangleEdge.BOTTOM, info);
488        AxisState rangeAxisState = this.rangeAxis.draw(g2, dataArea.getMinX(),
489                area, dataArea, RectangleEdge.LEFT, info);
490        drawDomainGridlines(g2, dataArea, domainAxisState.getTicks());
491        drawRangeGridlines(g2, dataArea, rangeAxisState.getTicks());
492
493        Shape originalClip = g2.getClip();
494        Composite originalComposite = g2.getComposite();
495
496        g2.clip(dataArea);
497        g2.setComposite(AlphaComposite.getInstance(AlphaComposite.SRC_OVER,
498                getForegroundAlpha()));
499
500        render(g2, dataArea, info, null);
501
502        g2.setClip(originalClip);
503        g2.setComposite(originalComposite);
504        drawOutline(g2, dataArea);
505
506    }
507
508    /**
509     * Draws a representation of the data within the dataArea region.  The
510     * {@code info} and {@code crosshairState} arguments may be
511     * {@code null}.
512     *
513     * @param g2  the graphics device.
514     * @param dataArea  the region in which the data is to be drawn.
515     * @param info  an optional object for collection dimension information.
516     * @param crosshairState  collects crosshair information ({@code null}
517     *                        permitted).
518     */
519    public void render(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea,
520                       PlotRenderingInfo info, CrosshairState crosshairState) {
521        g2.setPaint(this.fastScatterPlotProduct.getPaint());
522
523        // if the axes use a linear scale, you can uncomment the code below and
524        // switch to the alternative transX/transY calculation inside the loop
525        // that follows - it is a little bit faster then.
526        //
527        // int xx = (int) dataArea.getMinX();
528        // int ww = (int) dataArea.getWidth();
529        // int yy = (int) dataArea.getMaxY();
530        // int hh = (int) dataArea.getHeight();
531        // double domainMin = this.domainAxis.getLowerBound();
532        // double domainLength = this.domainAxis.getUpperBound() - domainMin;
533        // double rangeMin = this.rangeAxis.getLowerBound();
534        // double rangeLength = this.rangeAxis.getUpperBound() - rangeMin;
535
536        if (this.data != null) {
537            for (int i = 0; i < this.data[0].length; i++) {
538                float x = this.data[0][i];
539                float y = this.data[1][i];
540
541                //int transX = (int) (xx + ww * (x - domainMin) / domainLength);
542                //int transY = (int) (yy - hh * (y - rangeMin) / rangeLength);
543                int transX = (int) this.domainAxis.valueToJava2D(x, dataArea,
544                        RectangleEdge.BOTTOM);
545                int transY = (int) this.rangeAxis.valueToJava2D(y, dataArea,
546                        RectangleEdge.LEFT);
547                g2.fillRect(transX, transY, 1, 1);
548            }
549        }
550    }
551
552    /**
553     * Draws the gridlines for the plot, if they are visible.
554     *
555     * @param g2  the graphics device.
556     * @param dataArea  the data area.
557     * @param ticks  the ticks.
558     */
559    protected void drawDomainGridlines(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea,
560            List ticks) {
561        if (!isDomainGridlinesVisible()) {
562            return;
563        }
564        Object saved = g2.getRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_STROKE_CONTROL);
565        g2.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_STROKE_CONTROL, 
566                RenderingHints.VALUE_STROKE_NORMALIZE);
567        for (Object o : ticks) {
568            ValueTick tick = (ValueTick) o;
569            double v = this.domainAxis.valueToJava2D(tick.getValue(),
570                    dataArea, RectangleEdge.BOTTOM);
571            Line2D line = new Line2D.Double(v, dataArea.getMinY(), v,
572                    dataArea.getMaxY());
573            g2.setPaint(getDomainGridlinePaint());
574            g2.setStroke(getDomainGridlineStroke());
575            g2.draw(line);
576        }
577        g2.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_STROKE_CONTROL, saved);
578    }
579
580    /**
581     * Draws the gridlines for the plot, if they are visible.
582     *
583     * @param g2  the graphics device.
584     * @param dataArea  the data area.
585     * @param ticks  the ticks.
586     */
587    protected void drawRangeGridlines(Graphics2D g2, Rectangle2D dataArea,
588            List ticks) {
589
590        if (!isRangeGridlinesVisible()) {
591            return;
592        }
593        Object saved = g2.getRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_STROKE_CONTROL);
594        g2.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_STROKE_CONTROL, 
595                RenderingHints.VALUE_STROKE_NORMALIZE);
596
597        for (Object o : ticks) {
598            ValueTick tick = (ValueTick) o;
599            double v = this.rangeAxis.valueToJava2D(tick.getValue(),
600                    dataArea, RectangleEdge.LEFT);
601            Line2D line = new Line2D.Double(dataArea.getMinX(), v,
602                    dataArea.getMaxX(), v);
603            g2.setPaint(getRangeGridlinePaint());
604            g2.setStroke(getRangeGridlineStroke());
605            g2.draw(line);
606        }
607        g2.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_STROKE_CONTROL, saved);
608    }
609
610    /**
611     * Returns the range of data values to be plotted along the axis, or
612     * {@code null} if the specified axis isn't the domain axis or the
613     * range axis for the plot.
614     *
615     * @param axis  the axis ({@code null} permitted).
616     *
617     * @return The range (possibly {@code null}).
618     */
619    @Override
620    public Range getDataRange(ValueAxis axis) {
621        Range result = null;
622        if (axis == this.domainAxis) {
623            result = this.xDataRange;
624        }
625        else if (axis == this.rangeAxis) {
626            result = this.yDataRange;
627        }
628        return result;
629    }
630
631    /**
632     * Calculates the X data range.
633     *
634     * @param data  the data ({@code null} permitted).
635     *
636     * @return The range.
637     */
638    private Range calculateXDataRange(float[][] data) {
639
640        Range result = null;
641
642        if (data != null) {
643            float lowest = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
644            float highest = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
645            for (int i = 0; i < data[0].length; i++) {
646                float v = data[0][i];
647                if (v < lowest) {
648                    lowest = v;
649                }
650                if (v > highest) {
651                    highest = v;
652                }
653            }
654            if (lowest <= highest) {
655                result = new Range(lowest, highest);
656            }
657        }
658
659        return result;
660
661    }
662
663    /**
664     * Calculates the Y data range.
665     *
666     * @param data  the data ({@code null} permitted).
667     *
668     * @return The range.
669     */
670    private Range calculateYDataRange(float[][] data) {
671
672        Range result = null;
673        if (data != null) {
674            float lowest = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
675            float highest = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
676            for (int i = 0; i < data[0].length; i++) {
677                float v = data[1][i];
678                if (v < lowest) {
679                    lowest = v;
680                }
681                if (v > highest) {
682                    highest = v;
683                }
684            }
685            if (lowest <= highest) {
686                result = new Range(lowest, highest);
687            }
688        }
689        return result;
690
691    }
692
693    /**
694     * Multiplies the range on the domain axis by the specified factor.
695     *
696     * @param factor  the zoom factor.
697     * @param info  the plot rendering info.
698     * @param source  the source point.
699     */
700    @Override
701    public void zoomDomainAxes(double factor, PlotRenderingInfo info,
702                               Point2D source) {
703        this.domainAxis.resizeRange(factor);
704    }
705
706    /**
707     * Multiplies the range on the domain axis by the specified factor.
708     *
709     * @param factor  the zoom factor.
710     * @param info  the plot rendering info.
711     * @param source  the source point (in Java2D space).
712     * @param useAnchor  use source point as zoom anchor?
713     *
714     * @see #zoomRangeAxes(double, PlotRenderingInfo, Point2D, boolean)
715     */
716    @Override
717    public void zoomDomainAxes(double factor, PlotRenderingInfo info,
718                               Point2D source, boolean useAnchor) {
719
720        if (useAnchor) {
721            // get the source coordinate - this plot has always a VERTICAL
722            // orientation
723            double sourceX = source.getX();
724            double anchorX = this.domainAxis.java2DToValue(sourceX,
725                    info.getDataArea(), RectangleEdge.BOTTOM);
726            this.domainAxis.resizeRange2(factor, anchorX);
727        }
728        else {
729            this.domainAxis.resizeRange(factor);
730        }
731
732    }
733
734    /**
735     * Zooms in on the domain axes.
736     *
737     * @param lowerPercent  the new lower bound as a percentage of the current
738     *                      range.
739     * @param upperPercent  the new upper bound as a percentage of the current
740     *                      range.
741     * @param info  the plot rendering info.
742     * @param source  the source point.
743     */
744    @Override
745    public void zoomDomainAxes(double lowerPercent, double upperPercent,
746                               PlotRenderingInfo info, Point2D source) {
747        this.domainAxis.zoomRange(lowerPercent, upperPercent);
748    }
749
750    /**
751     * Multiplies the range on the range axis/axes by the specified factor.
752     *
753     * @param factor  the zoom factor.
754     * @param info  the plot rendering info.
755     * @param source  the source point.
756     */
757    @Override
758    public void zoomRangeAxes(double factor, PlotRenderingInfo info, 
759            Point2D source) {
760        this.rangeAxis.resizeRange(factor);
761    }
762
763    /**
764     * Multiplies the range on the range axis by the specified factor.
765     *
766     * @param factor  the zoom factor.
767     * @param info  the plot rendering info.
768     * @param source  the source point (in Java2D space).
769     * @param useAnchor  use source point as zoom anchor?
770     *
771     * @see #zoomDomainAxes(double, PlotRenderingInfo, Point2D, boolean)
772     */
773    @Override
774    public void zoomRangeAxes(double factor, PlotRenderingInfo info,
775                              Point2D source, boolean useAnchor) {
776
777        if (useAnchor) {
778            // get the source coordinate - this plot has always a VERTICAL
779            // orientation
780            double sourceY = source.getY();
781            double anchorY = this.rangeAxis.java2DToValue(sourceY,
782                    info.getDataArea(), RectangleEdge.LEFT);
783            this.rangeAxis.resizeRange2(factor, anchorY);
784        }
785        else {
786            this.rangeAxis.resizeRange(factor);
787        }
788
789    }
790
791    /**
792     * Zooms in on the range axes.
793     *
794     * @param lowerPercent  the new lower bound as a percentage of the current
795     *                      range.
796     * @param upperPercent  the new upper bound as a percentage of the current
797     *                      range.
798     * @param info  the plot rendering info.
799     * @param source  the source point.
800     */
801    @Override
802    public void zoomRangeAxes(double lowerPercent, double upperPercent,
803                              PlotRenderingInfo info, Point2D source) {
804        this.rangeAxis.zoomRange(lowerPercent, upperPercent);
805    }
806
807    /**
808     * Returns {@code true}.
809     *
810     * @return A boolean.
811     */
812    @Override
813    public boolean isDomainZoomable() {
814        return true;
815    }
816
817    /**
818     * Returns {@code true}.
819     *
820     * @return A boolean.
821     */
822    @Override
823    public boolean isRangeZoomable() {
824        return true;
825    }
826
827    /**
828     * Returns {@code true} if panning is enabled for the domain axes,
829     * and {@code false} otherwise.
830     *
831     * @return A boolean.
832     */
833    @Override
834    public boolean isDomainPannable() {
835        return this.domainPannable;
836    }
837
838    /**
839     * Sets the flag that enables or disables panning of the plot along the
840     * domain axes.
841     *
842     * @param pannable  the new flag value.
843     */
844    public void setDomainPannable(boolean pannable) {
845        this.domainPannable = pannable;
846    }
847
848    /**
849     * Returns {@code true} if panning is enabled for the range axes,
850     * and {@code false} otherwise.
851     *
852     * @return A boolean.
853     */
854    @Override
855    public boolean isRangePannable() {
856        return this.rangePannable;
857    }
858
859    /**
860     * Sets the flag that enables or disables panning of the plot along
861     * the range axes.
862     *
863     * @param pannable  the new flag value.
864     */
865    public void setRangePannable(boolean pannable) {
866        this.rangePannable = pannable;
867    }
868
869    /**
870     * Pans the domain axes by the specified percentage.
871     *
872     * @param percent  the distance to pan (as a percentage of the axis length).
873     * @param info the plot info
874     * @param source the source point where the pan action started.
875     */
876    @Override
877    public void panDomainAxes(double percent, PlotRenderingInfo info,
878            Point2D source) {
879        if (!isDomainPannable() || this.domainAxis == null) {
880            return;
881        }
882        double length = this.domainAxis.getRange().getLength();
883        double adj = percent * length;
884        if (this.domainAxis.isInverted()) {
885            adj = -adj;
886        }
887        this.domainAxis.setRange(this.domainAxis.getLowerBound() + adj,
888                this.domainAxis.getUpperBound() + adj);
889    }
890
891    /**
892     * Pans the range axes by the specified percentage.
893     *
894     * @param percent  the distance to pan (as a percentage of the axis length).
895     * @param info the plot info
896     * @param source the source point where the pan action started.
897     */
898    @Override
899    public void panRangeAxes(double percent, PlotRenderingInfo info,
900            Point2D source) {
901        if (!isRangePannable() || this.rangeAxis == null) {
902            return;
903        }
904        double length = this.rangeAxis.getRange().getLength();
905        double adj = percent * length;
906        if (this.rangeAxis.isInverted()) {
907            adj = -adj;
908        }
909        this.rangeAxis.setRange(this.rangeAxis.getLowerBound() + adj,
910                this.rangeAxis.getUpperBound() + adj);
911    }
912
913    /**
914     * Tests an arbitrary object for equality with this plot.  Note that
915     * {@code FastScatterPlot} carries its data around with it (rather
916     * than referencing a dataset), and the data is included in the
917     * equality test.
918     *
919     * @param obj  the object ({@code null} permitted).
920     *
921     * @return A boolean.
922     */
923    @Override
924    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
925        if (obj == this) {
926            return true;
927        }
928        if (!super.equals(obj)) {
929            return false;
930        }
931        if (!(obj instanceof FastScatterPlot)) {
932            return false;
933        }
934        FastScatterPlot that = (FastScatterPlot) obj;
935        if (this.domainPannable != that.domainPannable) {
936            return false;
937        }
938        if (this.rangePannable != that.rangePannable) {
939            return false;
940        }
941        if (!ArrayUtils.equal(this.data, that.data)) {
942            return false;
943        }
944        if (!Objects.equals(this.domainAxis, that.domainAxis)) {
945            return false;
946        }
947        if (!Objects.equals(this.rangeAxis, that.rangeAxis)) {
948            return false;
949        }
950        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.fastScatterPlotProduct.getPaint(), that.fastScatterPlotProduct.getPaint())) {
951            return false;
952        }
953        if (this.fastScatterPlotProduct.getDomainGridlinesVisible() != that.fastScatterPlotProduct.getDomainGridlinesVisible()) {
954            return false;
955        }
956        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.fastScatterPlotProduct.getDomainGridlinePaint(),
957                that.fastScatterPlotProduct.getDomainGridlinePaint())) {
958            return false;
959        }
960        if (!Objects.equals(this.fastScatterPlotProduct.getDomainGridlineStroke(), that.fastScatterPlotProduct.getDomainGridlineStroke())) {
961            return false;
962        }
963        if (!this.fastScatterPlotProduct.getRangeGridlinesVisible() == that.fastScatterPlotProduct.getRangeGridlinesVisible()) {
964            return false;
965        }
966        if (!PaintUtils.equal(this.fastScatterPlotProduct.getRangeGridlinePaint(),
967                that.fastScatterPlotProduct.getRangeGridlinePaint())) {
968            return false;
969        }
970        if (!Objects.equals(this.fastScatterPlotProduct.getRangeGridlineStroke(), that.fastScatterPlotProduct.getRangeGridlineStroke())) {
971            return false;
972        }
973        return true;
974    }
975
976    /**
977     * Returns a clone of the plot.
978     *
979     * @return A clone.
980     *
981     * @throws CloneNotSupportedException if some component of the plot does
982     *                                    not support cloning.
983     */
984    @Override
985    public Object clone() throws CloneNotSupportedException {
986
987        FastScatterPlot clone = (FastScatterPlot) super.clone();
988                clone.fastScatterPlotProduct = (FastScatterPlotProduct) this.fastScatterPlotProduct.clone();
989        if (this.data != null) {
990            clone.data = ArrayUtils.clone(this.data);
991        }
992        if (this.domainAxis != null) {
993            clone.domainAxis = (ValueAxis) this.domainAxis.clone();
994            clone.domainAxis.setPlot(clone);
995            clone.domainAxis.addChangeListener(clone);
996        }
997        if (this.rangeAxis != null) {
998            clone.rangeAxis = (ValueAxis) this.rangeAxis.clone();
999            clone.rangeAxis.setPlot(clone);
1000            clone.rangeAxis.addChangeListener(clone);
1001        }
1002        return clone;
1003
1004    }
1005
1006    /**
1007     * Provides serialization support.
1008     *
1009     * @param stream  the output stream.
1010     *
1011     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1012     */
1013    private void writeObject(ObjectOutputStream stream) throws IOException {
1014        stream.defaultWriteObject();
1015        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.fastScatterPlotProduct.getPaint(), stream);
1016        SerialUtils.writeStroke(this.fastScatterPlotProduct.getDomainGridlineStroke(), stream);
1017        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.fastScatterPlotProduct.getDomainGridlinePaint(), stream);
1018        SerialUtils.writeStroke(this.fastScatterPlotProduct.getRangeGridlineStroke(), stream);
1019        SerialUtils.writePaint(this.fastScatterPlotProduct.getRangeGridlinePaint(), stream);
1020    }
1021
1022    /**
1023     * Provides serialization support.
1024     *
1025     * @param stream  the input stream.
1026     *
1027     * @throws IOException  if there is an I/O error.
1028     * @throws ClassNotFoundException  if there is a classpath problem.
1029     */
1030    private void readObject(ObjectInputStream stream)
1031            throws IOException, ClassNotFoundException {
1032        stream.defaultReadObject();
1033
1034        fastScatterPlotProduct.setPaint2(SerialUtils.readPaint(stream));
1035        fastScatterPlotProduct.setDomainGridlineStroke2(SerialUtils.readStroke(stream));
1036        fastScatterPlotProduct.setDomainGridlinePaint2(SerialUtils.readPaint(stream));
1037
1038        fastScatterPlotProduct.setRangeGridlineStroke2(SerialUtils.readStroke(stream));
1039        fastScatterPlotProduct.setRangeGridlinePaint2(SerialUtils.readPaint(stream));
1040
1041        if (this.domainAxis != null) {
1042            this.domainAxis.addChangeListener(this);
1043        }
1044
1045        if (this.rangeAxis != null) {
1046            this.rangeAxis.addChangeListener(this);
1047        }
1048    }
1049
1050}
